thread.title: Gold rises as buzz around China’s surprise yuan move persists
thread.title_full: Gold rises as buzz around China’s surprise yuan move persists - MarketWatch

author: Victor Reklaitis
title: Gold rises as buzz around China’s surprise yuan move persists
text:
Gold futures gained early Monday, as analysts said that China’s devaluation of its currency could help the yellow metal, though only somewhat.
December gold GCZ5, +0.66% rose by $3.20, or 0.3%, to $1,115.90 an ounce, while September silver SIU5, +0.64% added a penny, or 0.1%, to $15.23 an ounce.
China’s move last week to devalue the yuan “can potentially delay a Fed rate hike in September, and thus is viewed as supportive for gold prices,” said Barclays analysts in a note Monday.
They said that gold did in fact rally “strongly on the surprise move” last week , but cautioned that “investor interest overall appears to lack conviction on gold.”
Gold, which offers no interest payments, could lose some of its appeal to higher-yielding assets if rates rise. So the gold market, like other financial markets, has been focused on whether the Federal Reserve will hike interest rates next month.
Gold’s gain on Monday came even as the dollar DXY, +0.00% advanced. A stronger buck often can weigh on dollar-denominated commodities like gold, as it makes them pricier for holders of other currencies.
In other metals, high-grade copper for September delivery HGU5, -1.59% dropped 2 cents, or 0.9%, to $2.33 a pound, while palladium for the same month PAU5, -0.57% shed 60 cents, or 0.1%, to $616.90 an ounce. October platinum PLV5, +0.04% gained $1.70, or 0.2%, to $995.70 an ounce.
U.S. stock futures were little changed , while European equities mostly advanced .
